question: 立つ
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means "stand" so what is the verb version of that? It's <vocabulary>to stand</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
You have to remember the <ja>た</ja> portion of this word to learn the reading of it. Think of it this way: 

You have <vocabulary>to stand up</vocabulary> in order to wave goodbye to someone. When you stand up, you also say <reading>ta</reading> ta (<ja>た</ja>)!
